Class LibraryBrowser

java.lang.Object
LibraryBrowser
public class LibraryBrowser
extends java.lang.Object
The main library browser module which runs the main loop and handles user input and high level command creation and execution.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private CommandInterpreter cmdIntrp
    Create and handle commands created via user input.
    private LibraryData data
    Book data currently loaded.
    private java.util.Scanner stdInScan
    Used to read user input from StdIO.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    LibraryBrowser()
    Create library browser.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void mainLoop()
    Main loop of the library browser programme.
    private java.lang.String promptUser()
    Display user command prompt and read corresponding input from StdIn.
    void run()
    Run the library browser and start the corresponding main loop.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • data

      private final LibraryData data
      Book data currently loaded.

    • cmdIntrp

      private final CommandInterpreter cmdIntrp
      Create and handle commands created via user input.

    • stdInScan

      private final java.util.Scanner stdInScan
      Used to read user input from StdIO. Only close shortly before program exit.

  • Constructor Details

    • LibraryBrowser

      public LibraryBrowser()
      Create library browser.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run the library browser and start the corresponding main loop.

    • mainLoop

      private void mainLoop()
      Main loop of the library browser programme. It asks for user input via a command prompt, creates a corresponding command and executes it.

    • promptUser

      private java.lang.String promptUser()
      Display user command prompt and read corresponding input from StdIn.
      Returns:
      provided user input or null if stream problem
